description: From Middle English gretnen (“to become great, be pregnant”), equivalent to great +‎ -en.

verbs.description: greaten (third-person singular simple present greatens, present participle greatening, simple past and past participle greatened)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To become great or large; increase; dilate.
(intransitive, obsolete) To become great with child; become pregnant.
(transitive) To make great; magnify; enlarge; increase.
examples: one studies how how to please his prince, the other how to greaten and secure him.
